results.title: Ping Pong
results.brief_description: An experimental abstract film. Animated sketches form and dissolve to background of music by percussion instruments. Stick figures and leg outlines glide and dance, flit and disintegrate into hail, through which a little girl wends with her umbrella. Occasionally the lively lines weaves into shapes that suggest the background of cymbals and drums.

results.title: Pine ways to profit
results.brief_description: The pine farmers in the South are learning to protect their forest as another source of income. The wood is used as chips, pulp, turpentine, poles, posts and stumps. They are at most risk from fire and prevention and cooperation between fire preventers and neighbours is essential. Methods of prevention and protection for seedlings are shown.

results.title: Pine Gap images
results.brief_description: A celebrations of documented images of the women’s protest camp at Pine Gap, Australian Northern Territory in November 1983. A series of images representing the feeling of some of the women acting for qualitative change and for world peace. A discussion starter about non-violent protest action.

results.title: Pigs to market
results.brief_description: This film shows that the production of fat, good quality pigs is dependent on up-to-date farming methods, and demonstrates correct feeding, quartering, and bedding for pigs.

results.title: Pigs on every farm
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Richard Warren
results.brief_description: A film for farmers on pig breeding. It shows that pigs may be a profitable sideline on most farms and that their care is simple.

results.title: Pigs and elephants
results.brief_description: An introduction to such animals as the babirusa, the wart hog of Africa, and the pygmy hippopotamus, showing that they are biologically related to the familiar domestic pig. Elephants of two varieties - Indian and African - are also studied.
results.description: An introduction to such animals as the babirusa, the wart hog of Africa, and the pygmy hippopotamus, showing that they are biologically related to the familiar domestic pig. Elephants of two varieties - Indian and African - are also studied.

results.title: Piet Mondriaan: un film essai
results.brief_description: By relating a careful selection of about fifty paintings and drawings, we trace Mondriaan’s development from naturalism through cubism to pure abstraction.
results.description: By relating a careful selection of about fifty paintings and drawings, we trace Mondriaan’s development from naturalism through cubism to pure abstraction.

results.title: Pierre
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Riss, Weston Woods Studios and Maurice Sendak
results.brief_description: An indifferent little boy flaunts an “I don’t care” attitude, until an encounter with a lion helps him change his mind. An excerpt from the film, “Really Rosie” adapted from “The Nutshell Kids” by Maurice Sendak with music composed and performed by Carole King.
